children.value: The Zendesk integration uses Extensions, Targets and Triggers to send Zendesk Support Ticket events to PagerDuty, triggering incidents.
The PagerDuty app for Zendesk retrieves and interacts with the PagerDuty incident from the Zendesk User Interface.
Ticket events are sent from Zendesk in JSON format to PagerDuty's Events API based on the Conditions and Actions set during Trigger configuration in Zendesk.
These events will turn into incidents in PagerDuty, notifying the configured serviceâ€™s on-call responders.
: A base role of Manager or higher is required to configure this integration. If you're not sure what role you have, or if you need your permissions adjusted, visit our sections on
: An Administrator role or higher is required to install the app and configure extensions and Triggers.
There are two ways that Zendesk can be integrated with PagerDuty: via Global Event Rules or through an integration on a PagerDuty Service.
may be beneficial if you want to build different routing rules based on the payload coming from Zendesk.
may be beneficial if you don't need to route alerts from Zendesk to different responders based on the event payload.

Next, you will be prompted for a JSON body that takes Zendesk Placeholder values. We have provided a sample JSON body that you can use out-of-the-box. If you want to modify the payload in any way, here are some rules to keep in mind:
. The PagerDuty plugin looks for Zendesk-created incidents with that pattern as a key. Changing this may result in the App Plugin not being able to retrieve the associated PagerDuty incident.

There are two ways to test the integration:
Modify the ticket created in the last step to meet the Conditions for the Trigger to execute. This should automatically trigger an Event API call once the Priority is set to
You may also create a ticket after signing in to PagerDuty from the Zendesk interface and click the blue
button. On the next screen, select which PagerDuty service you would like to open an incident on.

#FAQ
##Iâ€™m using the Business Rules Triggers in Zendesk to trigger notifications to PagerDuty, and incidents are being created, but the PagerDuty App in Zendesk is not loading the incident information on the ticket. Whatâ€™s happening here?

##Will PagerDuty create a new Zendesk ticket if thereâ€™s a non-Zendesk-generated incident on the same service?
No, PagerDuty will not create a new Zendesk Support Ticket if thereâ€™s an incident that did not originate from Zendesk.
##How does the PagerDuty app in Zendesk look up the incident? What if there are users that shouldnâ€™t have access those incidents?

The PagerDuty app utilizes OAuth to determine the userâ€™s permissions to access incidents within PagerDuty. If the user does not have access to a teamâ€™s incidents, the PagerDuty app will not display that information in the side bar app.
